name: Fractured Beatles Quiz | Beatles, The | 10 Questions

questions.text:
Here's an easy one to get you going.
"Pool my cart knee"
questions.explanation:
Paul McCartney.

	James Paul McCartney played bass guitar for the band.The story of the Beatles began in 1957 when John Lennon was performing with his band The Quarry Men.A friend introduced Paul to John and within a few months the two men, who were to reshape pop music, were performing on stage together.

questions.text:
This one is a place associated with the Beatles.
"Love a pull"
questions.explanation:
Liverpool.

	Liverpool is the home city of the Beatles, in their early days it was here that they performed to enthusiastic fans at the Cavern Club.

questions.text:
This is a person associated with the Beatles.
"Joke oh! oh! no"
questions.explanation:
Yoko Ono.

	Yoko Ono was born in Japan in 1933. She married John Lennon on the Rock of Gibraltar in 1969. John and Yoko released many collaborative tracks, including "Give Peace a Chance", as The Plastic Ono Band.

questions.text:
This one should be easy.
"Wrong ghost ah!"
questions.explanation:
Ringo Starr.

	Drummer Ringo Starr was the last member to be recruited to the Beatles.He replaced the band's original drummer, Pete Best, in 1962.

questions.text:
The Beatles owned this.
"Appeal reek chords"
questions.explanation:
Apple Records.

	The Beatles created Apple records in 1968.The first album released on the label was "Two Virgins" by John Lennon and Yoko Ono.

John Lennon.

	John Winston Lennon, in partnership with Paul McCartney, wrote most of the Beatles hit singles.He played rhythm guitar, piano and numerous other instruments.John was born in Liverpool in 1940, he was murdered in New York in 1980.

questions.text:
This is a Beatles album title.
"Rob her sole"
questions.explanation:
Rubber Soul.

	The "Rubber Soul" album was released in 1965.Tracks on the album include, "Michelle", "Girl", "Drive My Car" and "I'm Looking through You".

questions.text:
A person closely associated with the Beatles.
"Bray on epée steam"
questions.explanation:
Brian Epstein.

	Brian Epstein became the Beatles manager in 1962.Epstein was a Liverpool record store owner, and he became aware of the Beatles when young fans came to his shop asking for recordings by the band.After seeing the group perform at the Cavern Club he was sufficiently impressed and took on the management role.

questions.text:
Here's another album title.
"A bee rode"
questions.explanation:
Abbey Road.

	The "Abbey Road" album was named after the road in which E.M.I's recording studios are located.The famous picture on the album sleeve shows the Beatles on the zebra crossing located a short distance from the studios.

questions.text:
And the last one should need no clue.
"Gorge hair raising"
questions.explanation:
George Harrison.

	George Harrison played lead guitar and also wrote many songs for the band.George was born in Liverpool in 1943, he died in 2001.The Beatles last public performance was an impromptu concert on the roof of the Apple Records building in January 1969.
